name: SEDULUR 4 KALIMO PANCER
description:
Javanese cultures of spiritual

Sajen Sedulur Papat is one of the offerings or offerings in the form of various types of rice or sega to honor the four supernatural brothers who are in the four corners of the wind or commonly called Sedulur papat lima pancer.[1][2] From generation to generation, Javanese people are attached to the belief that everyone has four magical brothers who are in the north, south, east, and west according to the direction of the wind.[1][3][2] The brothers on the east side are called Tirtanata, those on the north side are called Warudijaya, those on the south side are called Purbangkara and those on the west side are called Sinotobrata.[1][3] While Pancer is oneself or conscience.[1][3] Sedulur papat has the ability and control the conscience of each person.[1][3][2] Thus, from generation to generation it is believed that if people want to be guarded, reminded or controlled from evil desires and influences, then that person is obliged to greet the four brothers and sisters in each direction of the wind.[1][3][2] source wikipedia
